heading: Sapphire Indian Cuisine
description:
Boxed in by a wraparound patio, Sapphire Indian Cuisine catches the passerby's eye in the Royal Palm Plaza, with almost entirely glass walls revealing elegant, indoor seat- ing. Its simple white tablecloths and black light fixtures allow diners to focus on the most important element – the eclectic spices and sauces served with each dish.

Raju Brahmbhatt, Sapphire Indian Cuisine owner and chef, brings to Boca a dining destination that promises authentic, sophisticated Indian cuisine.

Start with the samosa, crispy turnovers stuffed with seasoned potatoes and green peas, or the Lasooni Gobi, cauliflower spears spiced with chili flakes and garlic tomato chutney and coated in crispy florets.

For the main course, try Hydrabadi Murg Korma – roasted chicken drowned in a saffron and cashew sauce; or the Kerala Shrimp Curry, cooked in coconut milk, curry leaf and mustard seed, and finished with smoked kudampuli. Pair dishes with the garlic, rosemary or plain Naan – white flour bread baked in a clay oven.

For dessert – possibly the most delectable moment of the meal – try the coconut Kheer rice pudding sprinkled with crushed pistachio.

Sapphire Indian Cuisine, Royal Palm Place, 500 Via De Palmas, Ste. 79, Boca Raton / 561.362.2299 / sapphireboca.com
